intro: Salvia lavandulifolia subsp. maurorum, commonly known as narrow-leaf sage, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its narrow, gray-green leaves and spikes of pale violet to blue flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and has a mild, aromatic scent. The leaves are sometimes used in herbal teas and traditional remedies.
